text: hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura to kitchen I want to share with
you a really delicious but easy burger

make it in a cast-iron skillet or on a
little barbecue outside for a big
get-together it's my chorizo burgers
they're so easy but they are packed with
flavor and they are just a definite
must-have for this time of year
the ingredients you'll need are
literally less than five just very few
ground beef this is some raw mexican
chorizo it looks exhausted but it's
chorizo and I took it out of the casing
I've got some chopped scallions and

and pepper and I've got some toppings
back there I've got some babe lettuce
I've got some pickles I've got some buns
easy peasy just you wait okay so once
you have your ground beef and your

between Mexicans raw cereza and the
Spanish trees are you used to seeing the
spanish chorizo is already cooked kind
of looks like salami you cut it into big
fat coins you can use it you can saute
it into things but it's just it's
different but they both kind of have
that same flavor packed with garlic tons
of smoky paprika and it is absolutely to
die for and this combination is
incredible so what you gonna do is
you're gonna add your chopped scallions
or some whatever you call them scallions
green onions a little bit of black
pepper now the chorizo is quite hot so
I'm going to need to add a lot of pepper
and a good pinch of salt and now I'm
going to just mix everything together
until it's well combined now at this

just to kind of get the size of every
single one and then we'll shape them so
I want to
them just be about the same size because
it's not fair somebody that's a bigger

quite fair around here all I'm doing is
just flattening these out and then the
trick to making a burger so it won't

indentation in the in the very center of
the burger like that make almost like a
little hollow spot and that and so that
way when it cooks up and it puffs up it
just puffs up to the same size as the
corners so I'm going to continue to do
that I've got my grill pan preheating
over about medium-high heat running
between medium and medium-high you don't
want it too high otherwise they're just
not going to cook all the way through
and these you know it you should cook
these all the way through because the
chorizo it has pork in it so
unfortunately this is not a burger you

whatnot this is a burger you cook all
the way through but because you have the
chorizo in there that's made with pork
it's going to give you incredible moist
and juiciness and it's just going to be
so good so just trust me when I tell you
that these are out of this world once I
have all of these forms I'm gonna put

they're fully cooked all the way through
the last one to go on little is smaller
than the rest but you know what I'll

like a very well toasted little pop
